page.title: 13CHEDWORTH ROMAN VILLA -TODAY
page.content: { The extensive remains of the {Romano British villa make it one {of the best known in the country. }The remains are on three sides of a courtyard, with the{mosaic floors and {bath houses of particular interest.The {National Trust}has owned it since 1924 and being {one of its most visited {possessions has caused some problems. { The pretty and secluded nature of {the steep sided wooded valley }make it undesirable _ even if possible _ to enlarge the car park and build tourist facilities. With the surrounding woods private, very little room for picnics and no food/drink available, visitors quickly drive away.{The site is spared {a busy commercial tourist atmosphere. {Facilities relevant to the Villa {are excellent}_ lecture room, guides, introductory film, shop, Roman puzzle/ quiz sheets for children and a museum.
